intro: Oldenlandia xanthochroa, commonly known as the golden starflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble stars. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
